byline.original: By PETER BAKER and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin and Pres Obama speak over phone in first instance of direct contact between two leaders in four months due to Russian actions in Ukraine; discuss fight against Islamic State, spread of radicalism in Middle East and negotiations with Iran over its nuclear program; American officials say Obama focused on conflict in Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: The Russian president called to talk about the battle against ISIS, while the American president focused on the separatist war in Ukraine.

headline.main: Putin Breaks Silence With Call to Obama Touching on Ukraine and ISIS
headline.print_headline: Calling Obama, Putin Breaks His Silence

snippet: The Russian president called to talk about the battle against ISIS, while the American president focused on the separatist war in Ukraine.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
